intro: Adenia bequaertii subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as the western Adenia, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces distinctive, fleshy fruits that are typically red or orange when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
